lexUnit.name: scatter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: throw in various random directions.

sentence.text: After less than a half-hour of sitting alone he would grow restless , scatter his books untidily about the table and disappear outside .
He scattered the letters across his desk .

What could be the point of life without that great sweeping tail that could scatter the stars across the sky , without the dark rumbling tenderness when they slept together after their soaring adventures .
Before drinking he fumbles with a cigarette paper , overloading it with tobacco , scattering flakes across the table , into the booze .
He scattered his clothes across West London in a variety of dustbins and builder 's skips .
In a brief space of time , she had scattered offspring around the country and omitted to let any of them know each other .
Some churches are happy to scatter the ashes in the graveyard or bury them according to the family 's wishes .
As the drumming built to a crescendo , the coffin lid snapped open , scattering coins into the dust .
They rattled as she stalked , sometimes alarming her prey , and so she scattered them into the sand , to be ingested by the things that lived below the dunes .
He jerked out drawers and scattered their contents on the floor , dragged all her clothes from the wardrobe , threw out her shoes , then pulled Ruth herself from the bed and ripped off the sheets .
If you scatter seed on the ground you will build up a substantial clientele of birds such as chaffinches which do not readily come to hanging food and birdtables .
Pour the pasta into the baking dish and scatter the peas on top , then mix the bean mixture with two ounces of the cheese and spread it over the peas .

The girl , thin-faced and undernourished , watched with complete indifference as Jessica then took them to the parapet and scattered them onto the turbulent black surface of the river , where they swirled beautifully , made changing patterns as they swept between the steep stone walls .
Yes , there are enthusiasts who scatter it on to their scallops , mash it into their spinach and , quite possibly , stir it into their tea .
The Star carried three pictures of her scattering her scarves upon the heads of cheerful spectators : ` Ex TV Weathergirl sends the barometer rising " .
Slice the ginger paper-thin and scatter it , along with the onion slices , over the fish .
There they witnessed the blood of sacrifices , human as well as animal , being scattered over ornaments including a ceremonial collar of fifteen to twenty coral necklaces .
They scattered drugs and lab equipment over the floor , and opened a fridge door containing radioactive materials marked ` dangerous " .
He 'd scatter some of the grain he 'd nicked , and fetch down the wire and cutters , and his books .
She asked permission to scatter her husband 's ashes on the ballroom floor . "
I do n't know whether this is optional … is “ being severed in two , bowels turned to ashes and these ashes scattered over the face of the earth . ”
